document.title: History and Social Science Standards of Learning for Virginia Public Schools

C5AD6066B3DF473292C8BCF1BCAE65C3.description:
researching jobs and careers in the public and private sector and understanding the
pathways to various careers.

619998B28F4545DCAAF58B40C67DDBEC.description: describing the importance of equal opportunities for access to education and training; and

811E2A8B81FC4EFF9A004F8DB485DAA0.description:
analyzing the role of financial responsibility in good citizenship, including, but not limited
to evaluating common forms of credit, savings, and investments;

75366AA6CCA04A6DA3982EF9223F1874.description:
describing the importance of education to one’s intellectual life, lifelong learning, and
personal goals;

F581AD08A5E3472989E6647BFEF955B1.description: examining the effect of technological change and globalization on career opportunities;

E81E5E82B7AA4CC8AEE269189F5FC036.description:
identifying human capital, abilities, intellectual and physical skills, work habits, and
education and the changing supply of and demand for them in the economy;

024F8DFE19864462B1F8C916835D00FE.description:
identifying the attitudes and behaviors that strengthen the individual work ethic and
promote career success;

30343C2931EB4CC3BB48D96F5FCD6151.description: identifying the talents, interests, and aspirations that can influence career choice;

041E82480CD94DBD8EC9A6585ED92585.description:
The student will apply history and social science skills to explain career opportunities and
understand the fundamentals of personal finance by

9F15833BE79D49EEB1A69C7890C04F04.description:
evaluating how and why governments regulate industry, labor, competition, and
monopolies in the marketplace.

282D71F269F348BFA5AAAE0332A19F19.description:
describing how governments regulate commerce to protect consumers, the environment,
competition in the marketplace, and property rights; and

CEE952607DEA4114A6AD8E192EBD94B1.description:
explaining the role of government currency and analyzing the purpose of a money
economy;

54A102BC36E44790B02FE20880A0148D.description:
explaining the structure and main function of the Federal Reserve System and how it acts as
the nation’s central bank;

9B7D8AAE71BA479CA5459A350CD8079A.description:
describing how local, state, and federal governments allocate their budgets and collect taxes
to pay for goods and services;

CFA907EE1A3044378DF39058AF095EF4.description: explaining how and why government provides certain public goods and services;

47433398365B4F21AF9E44D39FF0E017.description: examining the effect of competition in the marketplace;

177B008C3371479A9CB2336B472C69D7.description:
The student will apply history and social science skills to analyze the role of government in the
United States economy by

9918636631FE47CAB97EFBE8B4A7377E.description:
analyzing the role of Virginia in the United States and global economies, with an emphasis
on the effect of technological innovations.

6C805CCA8E824893AF0DC7075FF0F64D.description:
explaining how financial institutions are critical to creating capital to fuel economic growth
for individuals and the larger economy by channeling funds from savers to borrowers
through lending; and

722895ECB5564BE6808EA73410021C82.description: explaining the role of consumers, producers, and government interactions on the economy;

7B798BFFC44A49A6B579DAE86A37B8F2.description: describing the types of business organizations and the role of entrepreneurship;

23BC88FFCA47441BB45172973B1D6CF3.description:
explaining the effect of supply and demand in a market economy on consumer prices and
the concept of inflation;

22ECB7F318F3453687A0CD2AEC24CCED.description:
describing the critical components of the United States economy, such as limited
government, private property, markets, consumer sovereignty, and competition;

D6EB8512BDC74B2CBD742315074996AE.description:
evaluating the shared fundamental principles and connection of free enterprise and
democracy;

D709EF109D6A4B6C870112BD827689F2.description:
The student will apply history and social science skills to describe the United States economy
by

CF8E3164C7DE46AA9ADC22D0EB2AE6A0.description:
comparing and contrasting free-market, command, and mixed economies to determine how
each affects the allocation of limited resources and the subsequent effects on individuals’
lives.

FABD2787DDDA4D07A7183D143EAF8D89.description:
explaining the importance of innovation and productivity, including the freedom to choose
occupations, the role of technology, and the development of human capital; and

6CF0593A9E564C3A82A45DDA1D146156.description:
explaining that because of scarcity, consumers, producers, and governments must make
economic choices, and understanding that all choices have an opportunity cost;

A5220791A7DE41F2ABDDC91D94B03E24.description:
The student will apply history and social science skills to analyze how economic decisions are
made in the marketplace and in daily life by

F5E254644A1545B790BF9046023BC635.description: explaining voter eligibility and requirements for registration.

4E9FE393B2FC4769BA543457866D7315.description: evaluating voting dates and processes in Virginia; and

A7CB034297764B1AADE99D5BC8CC658B.description:
describing duties of citizens, including paying taxes, serving on a jury, following the law,
voting, and registering for selective service;

D965F820B4D84EE481F80E77A4DD49C9.description:
The students will apply history and social science skills to analyze the role of public
participation in American civic life by

9C49A0B06938438D8387B687EE9DB8CA.description:
evaluating multiple sources describing the same event or idea and reflecting on the reasons
for any discrepancies.

46D29C98445747749341D29B6A145BCF.description:
identifying the source of information and considering possible motivations or biases of its
creator; and

1F0F3C0313D04807B7E76A65F0905F40.description: evaluating the effect of social media on political campaigns, politics, and civic discourse;

BB7751DB06CE461CBFBA6EE0AF2FE149.description:
explaining that individuals play in the political policy-making process by expressing their
opinions formally or informally via print, electronically, or in person;

D081FDCBDDA1472DB8FCBDCB48C4292D.description: describing the effect biased reporting can have on public opinion;

3A6A20D034B74FD6AA4743896170292C.description: explaining the role and rights of the press in reporting events;

C601CE5FABA748908D4626E1CD700597.description:
The student will apply history and social science skills to explain the role of the media and
social media and the influence on local, state, and national levels of government by

D16C19A1C61C4B5892B12E39B1818C34.description:
describing the role of the Electoral College in the election of the president and vice
president.

C848A97DBB3940AE98A69D35DDA26B97.description: examining the history of and requirements for voter registration; and

2A79E00143E54124851541759E2B3642.description: explaining the role of campaign contributions and the cost of campaigns;

6B0B04BE895444C29FD1C79A626D48B8.description:
analyzing campaigns for elective office, with emphasis on the roles of candidates,
volunteers, the media, voters, and poll watchers;

0ADF2888B871420288FBC6C2871E46F2.description: describing the origins, history, and functions of political parties;

B7CE90882C7F4E58851D62B2221C43D2.description:
The student will apply history and social science skills to examine the political process at the
local, state, and national levels of government by

586115F398E048FEB9E43F74042877A6.description:
The student will apply history and social science skills that exhibit effective and respectful
participation in civic life, including, but not limited to civility, trustworthiness and honesty,
courtesy and respect for the rights of others, personal responsibility, military service, selfreliance, hard work, respect for the law, patriotism, and service in one’s community.

D70E7B6C833C467685DCCBCBCCEE9FC4.description: reviewing the criteria and exam for naturalizing U.S. citizens.

57408D21E26F45E187299D28CC6903F3.description:
examining the process and importance of immigration policies at different points in U.S.
history; and

BD5D3219A9C0433CACCBE6CC6E5D90B4.description: describing the processes by which an individual becomes a citizen of the United States;

4646D339A4D74CABAAF94BE4C9E25E1E.description: The student will apply history and social science skills to define citizenship by

440FA9BD4DE84EA1A4FB265D854C280A.description:
explaining the effects of Supreme Court cases affecting the judiciary, including, but not
limited to Marbury v. Madison.

A0DD89C34937400C9CDB8734AA474649.description: comparing and contrasting civil and criminal cases; and

D222287A8B8240939B72F69976F79C26.description: describing how due-process protections seek to ensure justice;

C0EFF4E53EAF4ECC9883D6233EE87AE7.description:
describing the system of state and federal courts, including, but not limited to jurisdiction
and judicial review;

6D529DDEF2344B05ACFF205C5B1679F0.description:
The student will apply history and social science skills to explain the judicial systems
established by the Constitution of Virginia and the Constitution of the United States by

A3CA8D72B204456EBA77DB3F1E62D7E3.description:
comparing and contrasting powers and responsibilities of local, state, federal, and tribal
governments, including, but not limited to citizen engagement, how each is financed, and
how they work together and independently.

4B7A88B0E980412D94FA018745A0E02A.description:
describing how state, national, and international issues and events impact local decision
making; and

1020137B6C264B7B8B0B215CCAF3BFC3.description:
describing the structure and powers of the local government and explaining the local
lawmaking process;

4A663A7E08514547B923DA8133B94BF1.description:
The student will apply history and social science skills to analyze American constitutional
government at the local level by

DCA2093C472C40A28FD84604DC0043DA.description:
explaining the principle of separation of powers and the operation of checks and balances at
the state level.

809EED99E7534476AB0A2191E01ECDF4.description:
explaining the relationship between state governments and the national government in the
federal system, referencing Federalist No.10 and Federalist No. 51; and

7953191BFF40459AA29239E772D922A2.description:
describing the roles and powers of the executive branch and regulatory boards as they
affect states;

08DD52D80A9749D9966EF76261CE4DC7.description:
describing the structure and powers of the state government (the three branches of
government);

343113C6EA8E4AD3A2CF0D8AAB99E434.description:
The student will apply history and social science skills to analyze how constitutional
government functions at the state level by

50DF4B400471429B8A7DD3196387E9BE.description: explaining the principle of separation of powers and the operation of checks and balances.

3F6E890C8360400BB67F01BBE5DBCD8A.description:
explaining the particular role and powers of the judicial branch as explained in Article III of
the U.S. Constitution; and

E57E56B45C584C7C965CB339BEB3B2AB.description:
explaining the particular role and powers of the executive branch as explained in Article II
of the U.S. Constitution;

B6771943B8EC47C6B868265BCCFCE264.description:
explaining the legislative branch and the lawmaking process as explained in Article I of the
U.S. Constitution;

6EFEB1334ACE4208A69385626ED5CCC7.description: describing the structure and powers of the government (the three branches of government);

DEC30ACD492E4608BBAF297802FC4741.description:
The student will apply history and social science skills to analyze how American constitutional
government functions at the national level by

1B5AB29325464084809F3EB3735579D9.description: describing the procedures for amending the Constitution of Virginia and the Constitution of the United States.

F9631359A5B4417CBB787613D7FFEDF4.description:
explaining the fundamental concepts of the U.S. government, including but not limited to
due process, equal justice under the law, equal protection, elections and a representative
government, limited government, right to private property, rule of law, Supremacy Clause,
and separation of powers; and

7337A0702B2440C48538955DB8E162EE.description: describing the purpose of the Constitution of the United States as stated in its Preamble;

0D1E0D8034B9425E978011F87B954C6E.description:
comparing and contrasting debates, compromises, and plans surrounding the drafting and
ratification of the U.S. Constitution and the Bill of Rights;

AB7F9CFC78AD43E0926E3166E6B58A0A.description:
describing the Magna Carta, English common law, charters of the Virginia Company of
London (April 10, 1606; May 23, 1609; and March 12, 1612), the Virginia Declaration of
Rights, the Declaration of Independence, the Articles of Confederation, and the Virginia
Statute for Religious Freedom and their influence on the Constitution of Virginia and the
Constitution of the United States, including the Bill of Rights;

C278A9214E8D428F9E725A65E4153D63.description:
explaining the fundamental principles of limited government, republicanism, federalism,
checks and balances, separation of powers, and popular sovereignty;

BEAB20CC7A204D388A09B8D4BA22ED5A.description:
The student will apply history and social science skills to explain the foundations of the
American constitutional democracy by

5CFAB9E8E9954D4AA12CA472FBC0FA21.description:
developing products that reflect an understanding of research, content, and civics and
economic concepts.

E3C6DD783E184FAF985677ACDF3B3649.description:
engaging and communicating as a civil and informed individual with persons with different
perspectives; and

F06821D3CAD24C3C93C197F8CF0E58BA.description:
analyzing the costs and benefits and incentives and consequences of a specific choice using
various economic decision-making models;

69C1BC4652C24974BB7AFAA50E5D6A94.description: determining and explaining cause and effect relationships;

ED9EE90E2DDC4F16B58B92A7FF34A710.description: comparing and contrasting historical, cultural, economic, and political perspectives;

9E648BBB59834DDC9D889153709E877A.description:
integrating evidence to construct and analyze timelines, classify events, and to distinguish
fact and opinion;

1B13CC665A4647999072CE885BDC2FB2.description: developing questions, enhancing curiosity, and engaging in critical thinking and analysis;

B998D9554ABA4DBF95EF32FD8262C44A.description:
applying geographic skills to determine and predict patterns and trends of people, places, or
events;

83F7F609551541CF9C5238922839994C.description: The student will apply history and social science skills to the content by
